page.title: 06Local sewage works
page.content: {Sewage Works,(between Tollerton and {Cotgrave)} The purification plant near Cotgrave is manned by 3 operatives who are also responsible for plants at Radcliffe and Keyworth, and several pumping stations. The sewage comes from Cotgrave, Tollerton and Normanton on the Wolds. - 150 litres per person per day, in total, two-thirds of a million gallons daily. There is little industrial waste from the area, so 95% purification is achieved, to protect fish life. The treatment process uses biological filters, with naturally grown bacterial culture reducing the waste matter. Sludge collected from the settlement tanks is distributed to local farms as a free service.
